file_name: AudibleInc_20001113_10-Q_EX-10.32_2599586_EX-10.32_Co-Branding Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Investment Distribution Agreement.txt

perturbation.original_text: "Affiliate" means, with respect to any person or entity (including either Party), any other person or entity that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with that person or entity, or which that person or entity beneficially owns at least fifty percent (50%) of the equity interests therein (provided, however, that with respect to the Parties, no individual or entity as to which the ultimate parent entity of a Party does not directly or indirectly control the operations or management thereof (e.g., in the case of ACSI as of the date of this Agreement, Gear.com, Inc.) shall be deemed to be an Affiliate of such Party for purposes of this Agreement).
perturbation.changed_text: "Affiliate" means, with respect to any person or entity (including either Party), any other person or entity that directly or indirectly controls, is controlled by or is under common control with that person or entity, or which that person or entity beneficially owns at least twenty-five percent (25%) of the equity interests therein (provided, however, that with respect to the Parties, any individual or entity as to which the ultimate parent entity of a Party has operational ties, regardless of ownership percentage (e.g., in the case of ACSI as of the date of this Agreement, Gear.com, Inc.) shall be deemed to be an Affiliate of such Party for purposes of this Agreement).
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Affiliate" has been modified to include entities with only 25% ownership and those with 'operational ties,' contradicting the standard legal definition requiring significant control (typically 50% or more ownership). This creates ambiguity regarding which entities are bound by the agreement, potentially violating corporate law standards for defining affiliated entities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Corporate Law, specifically definitions of affiliated entities for liability and regulatory purposes.

perturbation.original_text: "Confidential Information" means, with respect to either Party, all information relating to such Party or its Affiliates that is designated as confidential or that, given the nature of the information or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, reasonably should be considered as confidential. Confidential Information includes, without limitation, (a) all information relating to a Party's or its Affiliates' technology, customers, business plans, promotional and marketing activities, finances and other business affairs; (b) all third party information that a Party or its Affiliates is obligated to keep confidential; and (c) the terms of this Agreement. Confidential Information may be contained in tangible materials, such as drawings, data, specifications, reports and computer programs, or may be in the nature of unwritten knowledge. Confidential Information does not include any information that (i) has become publicly available without breach of this Agreement, (ii) can be shown by documentation to have been known to the Receiving Party at the time of its receipt from the Disclosing Party or its Affiliates without a breach of confidentiality or other improper means, (iii) is received from a third party who did not acquire or disclose such information by a wrongful or tortious act or (iv) can be shown by documentation to have been independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to any Confidential Information.
perturbation.changed_text: "Confidential Information" means, with respect to either Party, all information relating to such Party or its Affiliates that is internally marked as confidential, irrespective of its nature or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure. Confidential Information includes only (a) financial projections explicitly labeled 'Confidential' and (b) data obtained directly from secure servers, but excludes third-party data, customer lists, and any technological information. Confidential Information includes any information that (i) has become publicly available without breach of this Agreement, (ii) can be shown by documentation to have been known to the Receiving Party at the time of its receipt from the Disclosing Party or its Affiliates without a breach of confidentiality or other improper means, (iii) is received from a third party who did not acquire or disclose such information by a wrongful or tortious act or (iv) can be shown by documentation to have been independently developed by the Receiving Party without reference to any Confidential Information.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Confidential Information" has been severely restricted, requiring internal markings and excluding broad categories of information that are typically considered confidential under trade secret law. This conflicts with the reasonable expectations of confidentiality and potentially undermines protections for sensitive business information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Law, specifically the Uniform Trade Secrets Act (UTSA) which protects a broader range of confidential business information.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party will comply, and will ensure that the Mirror Company Site, the Spoken-Word Audio Products and all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement (including, without limitation, the participation of ACSI and its Affiliates as contemplated by this Agreement) comply with all applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will endeavor to comply, to the best of their understanding, with laws they are directly notified of, pertaining specifically to their own operations, and any compliance of the Mirror Company Site, the Spoken-Word Audio Products and all other activities undertaken through or in connection with the Mirror Company Site and this Agreement shall be at the discretion of each individual party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates compliance with "all applicable Laws." The modified clause weakens this obligation, making compliance discretionary and limited to laws the parties are directly notified of. This contradicts the legal principle that parties are responsible for knowing and complying with all applicable laws, regardless of notification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of legal compliance, emphasizing the responsibility of parties to be aware of and adhere to all relevant laws and regulations.
